title: decimal d128 macro panics in 1.49.0-nightly
body:
On 1.49.0-nightly running under Windows 10, the `d128` macro in the [`decimal` crate](https://crates.io/crates/decimal/) panics on use. This does not occur on 1.46.0 (stable). Repro code is about as minimal as it gets: ```rust use decimal::d128; fn main() { let test_decimal: d128 = d128!(10); } ``` On 1.46.0 (stable), this runs without issue. On 1.49.0-nightly (nightly), this panics with the following message: ```thread 'main' panicked at 'attempted to leave type `context::Context` uninitialized, which is invalid', C:\Users\\.rustup\toolchains\nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib/rustlib/src/rust\library\core\src\mem\mod.rs:659:9``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: - Stable: ``` rustc 1.46.0 (04488afe3 2020-08-24) binary: rustc commit-hash: 04488afe34512aa4c33566eb16d8c912a3ae04f9 commit-date: 2020-08-24 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.46.0 LLVM version: 10.0 ``` - Nightly: ``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (91a79fb29 2020-10-07) binary: rustc commit-hash: 91a79fb29ac78d057d04dbe86be13d5dcc64309a commit-date: 2020-10-07 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.49.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0 ```
Build Log + Backtrace

``` C:/Users//.cargo/bin/cargo.exe run --color=always --package Testbed --bin Testbed warning: unused variable: `test_decimal` --> src\main.rs:4:9 | 4 | let test_decimal: d128 = d128!(10); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: if this is intentional, prefix it with an underscore: `_test_decimal` | = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default warning: crate `Testbed` should have a snake case name | = note: `#[warn(non_snake_case)]` on by default = help: convert the identifier to snake case: `testbed` warning: 2 warnings emitted Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.02s Running `target\debug\Testbed.exe` thread 'main' panicked at 'attempted to leave type `context::Context` uninitialized, which is invalid', C:\Users\\.rustup\toolchains\nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib/rustlib/src/rust\library\core\src\mem\mod.rs:659:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff6baefa659 - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::dbghelp::trace at /rustc/91a79fb29ac78d057d04dbe86be13d5dcc64309a\/library\std\src\..\..\backtrace\src\backtrace\dbghelp.rs:98 1: 0x7ff6baefa659 - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized at /rustc/91a79fb29ac78d057d04dbe86be13d5dcc64309a\/library\std\src\..\..\backtrace\src\backtrace\mod.rs:66 2: 0x7ff6baefa659 -
